final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from the contrast between the two panels. 

In the first panel, the person is holding a sign with "ACAB" (a phrase often associated with anti-police sentiment) in an anarchist style, suggesting a rebellious or anti-authority stance. 

In the second panel, the same person is shown dialing the emergency number "112" on a phone, which contradicts the initial defiant message. This juxtaposition highlights a satire on the hypocrisy or the practical reality that, despite anti-police sentiments, one might still rely on emergency services when in need. The "yes, but" format further emphasizes this contradiction, making the image satirical and funny.
ground_truth: This is funny because on the one hand this person is rebelling against cops (slogan being All Cops Are Bad - ACAB), but on the other hand they are also calling the cops for help.
